name: Alumahan
description: A small coastal pelagic fish found in tropical Indo-Pacific waters, known for its rich flavor and commonly used in Filipino dishes like paksiw and sinigang.

name: Arosep Seaweed
description: A type of green seaweed known for its tiny, grape-like appearance and crisp texture, often eaten raw in salads (ensaladang latô) with vinegar and tomatoes.

name: Bangus
description: The national fish of the Philippines, prized for its tender white flesh. Commonly prepared grilled, fried, or as sinigang. Known for its numerous fine bones.

name: Asohos
description: A slender, silver-white fish with dark bands, found in sandy coastal waters. Its delicate, sweet flavor makes it ideal for frying or grilling.

name: Bakoko
description: A streamlined fish with silver-gray to reddish-brown coloration, known for its mild yet distinctive flavor. Commonly found in coastal waters and popular in various cooking methods.

name: Bitilya
description: A colorful reef fish with elongated body and thread-like extensions on fins. Valued for its sweet, tender meat, often used in soups and stews.

name: Dalagang Bukid
description: A vibrant reef fish with a red belly and yellow tail, commonly found in schools. Its firm flesh is suitable for frying and grilling.

name: Dapa
description: A flatfish with both eyes on one side of its head, allowing it to lie flat on the seafloor. Known for its delicate flavor and tender texture.

name: Espada
description: A long, slender fish with a metallic sheen and sharp teeth. Its soft, white flesh is commonly grilled or fried.

name: Galunggong
description: A small, affordable fish with a distinct flavor, often dubbed the 'poor man's fish' in the Philippines. Commonly fried or used in stews.

name: Gindara
description: Known for its rich, buttery flavor and high oil content, perfect for grilling or broiling.

name: Kuhol
description: A freshwater snail often used in Filipino dishes like ginataang kuhol (snails in coconut milk).

name: Hasa Hasa
description: Mildly flavored fish typically grilled or fried, commonly found in Philippine markets.

name: Halaan Small/Medium
description: Bivalve shellfish known for its sweet taste, often used in soups and seafood stews.

name: Halaan Large
description: Larger variant of Halaan with more meat, best for steaming or grilling.

name: Lapu-Lapu Black Genuine
description: Highly prized fish with firm texture, commonly steamed or cooked with soy sauce.

name: Lato Seaweed
description: A type of edible seaweed that resembles green caviar, served fresh as salad.

name: Matambaka
description: Commonly fried or dried, this fish is flavorful and rich in omega-3.

name: Maya Maya
description: Delicate and sweet-tasting white fish often used in sinigang or grilled whole.

name: Oysters, Closed Full Shell
description: Whole oysters perfect for grilling or baking; requires shucking before eating.

name: Oysters, Open Half Shell
description: Ready-to-eat oysters best served raw with vinegar or lemon.

name: Pampano
description: Silvery fish with a delicate taste, popular for frying or grilling whole.

name: Salay Ginto
description: Common fish known for its lean meat and light flavor, ideal for frying or tinapa.

name: Samaral
description: Mild and slightly sweet fish, often cooked with coconut milk or grilled.

name: Sapsap
description: Flat, thin fish ideal for drying or pan-frying with simple seasoning.

name: Shrimp Jumbo
description: Large shrimp variety known for its juicy texture, best grilled or sautéed.

name: Shrimp Large
description: Flavorful and versatile shrimp used in a variety of dishes like sinigang or tempura.

name: Shrimp Small
description: Common shrimp variety ideal for sauces, stews, or omelets.

name: Squid Baby
description: Small squid often sautéed or cooked adobo-style; tender and flavorful.

name: Squid Large
description: Meaty squid perfect for stuffing or grilling; has a firm bite and rich flavor.

name: Squid Medium
description: Medium-sized squid used in many local dishes, ideal for frying or adobo.

name: Tahong Small
description: Green-lipped mussels perfect for soups or grilled with cheese and garlic.

name: Tahong Medium
description: Versatile shellfish used in various Filipino dishes like tinola or baked tahong.

name: Tahong Large
description: Best for hearty seafood recipes, these large mussels are rich and chewy.

name: Tawilis
description: Endemic to Taal Lake, often fried until crispy and served with vinegar dip.

name: Tilapia Medium/Large
description: Popular freshwater fish that's affordable and delicious, commonly fried or grilled.

name: Tiger Prawns Jumbo
description: Luxurious prawns ideal for grilling or seafood platters; sweet and juicy meat.

name: Tiger Prawns XJumbo
description: Extra-large prawns prized for their meatiness, often grilled or buttered.

name: Ulang / River Prawns
description: Freshwater prawn with a firm, sweet taste, ideal for sinigang or grilled.

name: Yellow Fin
description: Tuna species known for its mild flavor and firm texture, great for sashimi, steak, or sinigang.
